ARCHIVE MATERIALS

[/vc_column_text][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="40" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="30" screen_tablet_spacer_size="20" screen_mobile_spacer_size="15"][dfd_button button_text="Webinar Recording" main_style="style-2" tooltip_text="Click to Open in New Tab" buttom_link_src="url:https%3A%2F%2Fcommunity.aaii.com%2FHigherLogic%2FSystem%2FDownloadDocumentFile.ashx%3FDocumentFileKey%3D3352bb28-a7b6-7262-020b-be4bb4983281%26forceDialog%3D0||target:%20_blank|" undefined="" box_shadow="box_shadow_enable:disable|shadow_horizontal:0|shadow_vertical:15|shadow_blur:50|shadow_spread:0|box_shadow_color:rgba(0%2C0%2C0%2C0.35)" hover_box_shadow="box_shadow_enable:disable|shadow_horizontal:0|shadow_vertical:15|shadow_blur:50|shadow_spread:0|box_shadow_color:rgba(0%2C0%2C0%2C0.35)" title_font_options="font_size:20"][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="40" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="30" screen_tablet_spacer_size="20" screen_mobile_spacer_size="15"][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/4"][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner][vc_column_text]Callie Cox is the Chief Market Strategist at Ritholtz Wealth Management and the author of OptirmistiCalllie, a newsletter of Wall Street-quality research for everyday Investors.  She's passionate about teaching everyday investors the power of investing for their wallets and their lives. Prior to joining Ritholtz, Callie was the head of US research at eToro, one of the world's biggest social investing brokerages. Prior to eToro, she was on research teams at Ally Invest, LPL Financial, and TABB Group.  She's a Business Insider contributor, and her work has been featured in major publications such as CNBC, Bloomberg, the Financial Times, Yahoo Finance and Barron's.  She frequently shares market analysis on Twitter at @callieabost, and on Linkedin/Bluesky.[/vc_column_text][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="20" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="40" screen_tablet_spacer_size="30" screen_mobile_spacer_size="20"][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="20" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="40" screen_tablet_spacer_size="30" screen_mobile_spacer_size="20"][dfd_heading subtitle="" delimiter_settings="delimiter_style:solid|delimiter_width:0|delimiter_height:1" undefined="" title_font_options="tag:h2" subtitle_font_options="tag:div"]Mood swings: why market sentiment matters in investing[/dfd_heading][vc_column_text]Summary: Ask any market expert out there, and they'll tell you that markets follow profits and economic prosperity over time. While that’s technically true, I've got a better explanation for the daily ups and downs: mood swings. If you learn to track the market’s mood, you can better understand its movements – and your own behavioral tendencies – over time.[/vc_column_text][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="20" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="15" screen_tablet_spacer_size="15" screen_mobile_spacer_size="10"][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="20" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="15" screen_tablet_spacer_size="15" screen_mobile_spacer_size="10"][vc_column_text]
Attend this talk and learn...
[/vc_column_text][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="20" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="15" screen_tablet_spacer_size="15" screen_mobile_spacer_size="10"][dfd_icon_list module_animation="transition.slideRightBigIn" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="30" screen_tablet_spacer_size="20" screen_mobile_spacer_size="15"][vc_column_text]

ARCHIVE MATERIALS

[/vc_column_text][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="40" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="30" screen_tablet_spacer_size="20" screen_mobile_spacer_size="15"][dfd_button button_text="Webinar Recording" main_style="style-2" tooltip_text="Click to Open in New Tab" buttom_link_src="url:https%3A%2F%2Fcommunity.aaii.com%2FHigherLogic%2FSystem%2FDownloadDocumentFile.ashx%3FDocumentFileKey%3Dcceedde0-5dca-1ab6-5191-5703a257ce71%26forceDialog%3D0||target:%20_blank|" undefined="" box_shadow="box_shadow_enable:disable|shadow_horizontal:0|shadow_vertical:15|shadow_blur:50|shadow_spread:0|box_shadow_color:rgba(0%2C0%2C0%2C0.35)" hover_box_shadow="box_shadow_enable:disable|shadow_horizontal:0|shadow_vertical:15|shadow_blur:50|shadow_spread:0|box_shadow_color:rgba(0%2C0%2C0%2C0.35)" title_font_options="font_size:20" tutorials=""][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="40" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="30" screen_tablet_spacer_size="20" screen_mobile_spacer_size="15"][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/4"][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner][vc_column_text]Jack Bowers drew on his personal interest in investing and desktop publishing and a career at Hewlett-Packard to start the Fidelity Monitor newsletter in 1986. From those beginnings, he is now the CEO of Independent Fidelity Investors Inc., which publishes two newsletters, Fidelity Monitor and Fidelity Insight. He also serves as chief investment strategist of Weber Asset Management and CEO of Bowers Wealth Management Inc. Among newsletters tracked by the Hulbert Financial Digest, Fidelity Monitor is one of the top risk-adjusted performers over the last 20 years. Bowers has appeared on the Forbes Newsletter Honor Roll twice. He holds a bachelor’s degree in electrical engineering from Washington State University.[/vc_column_text][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="20" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="40" screen_tablet_spacer_size="30" screen_mobile_spacer_size="20"][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="20" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="40" screen_tablet_spacer_size="30" screen_mobile_spacer_size="20"][dfd_heading subtitle="" delimiter_settings="delimiter_style:solid|delimiter_width:0|delimiter_height:1" undefined="" title_font_options="tag:h2" subtitle_font_options="tag:div"]Ten Contrarian Thoughts[/dfd_heading][vc_column_text]
Being a contrarian means you have an opinion that runs counter to mainstream beliefs expressed by the financial media, economists, or analysts.  Join us as Jack Bowers challenges conventional wisdom on ten different topics. It will be an opportunity to:
[/vc_column_text][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="20" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="15" screen_tablet_spacer_size="15" screen_mobile_spacer_size="10"][dfd_icon_list module_animation="transition.slideRightBigIn" item.excerpt:encoded: Financial Education meeting information that focuses on the broad overview of basic individual investing in today's market.
